newsitem.title: USA: General Parcel to buy four trucking firms.
newsitem.headline: General Parcel to buy four trucking firms.

text.p: General Parcel Services Inc said Friday that it has signed non-binding letters of intent to acquire four privately held trucking companies for $30 million to $35 million in cash and stock.
The company said the proposed acquisitions involve profitable short- and long-haul trucking companies in the southeastern United States which have combined annual revenues of about $100 million.
The acquisitons, said General Parcel, should close in the third quarter, subject to due diligence, arrangement of financing and other customary terms and conditions.
The company said its acquisition criteria remain focused on mid-size trucking companies, mainly those with annual revenues between $10 million and $100 million.

The company also said that it has agreed to a debt- for-equity conversion that will virtually eliminate its long-term debt other than that for equipment, which it believes will be eliminated by the fourth quarter.

The company said that T. Wayne Davis, chairman of the board and majority shareholder, and his affiliates have agreed to assume about $5 million of company debt in exchange for the issuance of about 2.86 million shares of new common stock.
General Parcel also said that it has agreed to divest its courier operations, which yield $1 million in annual revenues, to Davis as part of the debt-for-equity exchange.
Final determination of the amounts involved in the exchange are expected to be completed by June 30.

In the coming months the company said it intends to make further changes in its remaining parcel delivery operations, either reducing their size to a level that can achieve profitability or eliminating them through sale or discontinuation.
The company will also change its name to Transit Group Inc effective June 30.
